headline: Balsamic Bruschetta
description: This easy recipe for homemade bruschetta comes together in no time. High quality balsamic vinegar, sun-ripened tomatoes, and basil are key ingredients in this summer appetizer.

video.description: Bruschetta is a classic Italian appetizer that is easy to make at home. Toasted bread is topped with tomatoes, Parmesan cheese, garlic, and fresh basil. Use a high-quality balsamic vinegar for best results.
video.name: Balsamic Bruschetta

name: Balsamic Bruschetta
recipeIngredient: 1 loaf French bread, cut into 1/4-inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Brush bread slices on both sides lightly with 1 tablespoon oil and place on large baking sheet. Toast bread until golden, 5 to 10 minutes, turning halfway through.
Meanwhile, toss together tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic in a bowl.
Mix in balsamic vinegar, 2 teaspoons olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper.
Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted bread slices.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely wonderful! The family raved about this dish. And yet so simple to make and tastes like I spent some time making 😉💃
I am trying to lose weight so am looking for vegetables to eat that are low carb and cal. I serve this without bread as a side fish and it works beautifully to add colour to a plate of food.
Loved it. Added sliced avacado
I loved this recipe. So flavorful. The only change I made is 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar. Fresh basil makes all the difference.
This was so tasty and so easy to make. I made the topping the night before and then toasted the bread right before my guests arrived. This is definitely a keeper!
The best I ever had! I used all fresh farmers market ingredients and it was a great success!
Yummy

Over all good recipe. The only change I have is that I sautéed shallots with the garlic and then the herbs at the end. Raw garlic can be pungent as well as raw herbs (but dried herbs can be added directly), so cook that up quickly to incorporate it together, let it cool, and then mix it with the tomato mixture. But still a good recipe to get started with a solid bruschetta!
This came out amazing. I made sure sure to use all fresh ingredients and herbs.

We LOVE this!! We do 3 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar and add a little extra oil as well. It is SO good! We love toasting a baguette, spreading a little cream cheese on it and topping it with the bruschetta!
Delicious!!!!!! :)
Was bland, will let it sit and probably use less olive oil on the bread, maybe more salt. Wished I had read to de seed the tomatoes first. Lots of juice in the bowl. But good.
This is a great recipe. When our Roma tomatoes are harvested I will make this recipe several times. It is amazing. Our friends and family love it! Good job
Delicious!
This was amazing! I agree to make it several hours prior to serving to meld thwe flavors.

This one is tricky. Bruschetta is definitely more of an adult dish, as the kids didn't really enjoy it, but they ate it nonetheless. I swapped out fresh basil for dried, as the supermarket had again run out of it in the produce section. Definitely prepare the tomato mixture the night before you plan to eat it. It allows the mixture to chill and to soak in its own juices, and it creates a very pleasant experience and also works to moisten the bread. Definitely a keeper, but sadly the kids weren't fond of it.
This was great! I had garlic infused olive oil I brushed the bread with and used finely diced garlic scapes instead of garlic. Awesome!
I used Campari tomatoes and seeded four out of six of them to leave a bit of the juices. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly. This was delicious! Everyone loved it.
It was absolutely delicious. I made the bruschetta and ended up having to keep it for hours in the fridge as something came up. Finished making later in the day and it was excellent.
Very easy dish. Added 2 table spoons garlic chives. Leave hang out in the fridge for at least hour before serving. But like one of the reviews mentioned..USE fresh ingredients.
This is my favorite recipe. I've tried quite a few but always come back.

I love this recipe, however because I live alone and don't make a lot of'party type food', I have modified this to suit my wants and lifestyle. I use a chunky, cilantro salsa from Sam's Club. The typical salsa dip is too juicy/runny to use. I am not fond of toasted bread so this is mostly a fork meal on a couple of slices of french bread topped with a drizzle of evoo.

To reduce the water content, I simply chop up the tomatoes, and strain in a mesh strainer before adding all the other ingredients. Works great and saves so much time. I make bruchetta weekly in the summer time, it is our favorite!
AAMAZING! We try to use the freshest organic veggies and top-quality organic extra virgin olive oil and Balsamic Vinegar of Modena, but I'm not sure any of which made a bit of difference 🤣 DELICIOUS

Excellent recipe! We prefer a bit more garlic so I used 3 cloves rather than 2. I did not have Roma tomatoes so used the regular ones we had gotten from the Farmer's Market (2 large ones). Turned out to be the right combination for us. I think you just need to modify as you like, but the basic recipe is a winner.
Didn't have basil so I used cilantro.
I added balsamic glaze drizzle (Trader Joe's).
Good recipe I used a asiago parmesan mix. Delicious
Loved it! Easy to make.
Love this one - definitely one of our go tos!
This recipe was simple and fun to make. The ending result tasted delicious and my family enjoyed it.

This recipe is so easy and so awesomely tasty. A friend and I had fun making this recipe together - and of course enjoying every bite. Another friend, who needs to limit bread is looking forward to enjoying this recipe as a side dish without the bread. Sounds great to me!
Delicious and simple! Loved it just as written.
Easy to prepare and delicious! Great holiday appetizer too.
I have made this all summer for the last couple of years. Growing my own tomatoes and basil, I always had an ample supply. Delish!!

Easy and delicious! As is, this recipe is a great 4 star recipe. It was quick and makes enough to serve a large crowd.
Wanna up it to 5 star? Toast your bread with a brush of olive oil and garlic powder. Then top your bruschetta with an extra drizzle of balsamic vinegar just before serving. Yum!
Outstanding! Make exactly as written. I toasted bread(s) first. Fabulous!

Perfectly simple Bruschetta topping. I was looking for a tasty recipe to use up some Roma tomatoes and came across this one. Anything with balsamic vinegar will always catch my attention. No need to peel or seed tomatoes - I cry a little each time I see that in a recipe. Such a needles step. I ended up warming a chopped garlic clove in some olive oil over a low heat - then used the olive oil for the bread and put the warmed garlic clove with a little of that olive oil in with the tomatoes. A great end of summer treat.

I mixed all the ingredients except the cheese together a few hours before serving and let it sit at room temperature. I added the cheese when I broiled the bread and served it immediately. I am not sure why some people refrigerate this before serving. Tomatoes lose flavor when they are chilled. FYI, I left the tomato seeds in and used a slotted spoon to place the mixture on the bread. The bread remained wonderfully crisp.
Love this simple recipe. Made it often.
Delicious. a definite keeper recipe. soooooo very good.
This was exactly what I was looking for. Refreshing and delicious!
I had no fresh basil, but I used dried basil and some marjoram. I added green onions and used balsamic reduction rather than straight balsamic. We loved it!

I love a BLT sandwich, but the tomatoes must be perfect or I won’t eat it. In the “off-season” I make this and use it like a tapenade on my sandwich with lettuce and bacon and some Mayo. It is SO delicious. One slight trick is to make sure you scoop out the seeds and watery part of the tomatoes and only dice up the outer flesh and skin or you will have a soggy mess. I also like a very small pinch of sugar. It just counterbalances the acidity nicely, but literally just a tiny pinch.
Missing something
I loved how the flavors developed. It was my first bruschetta and it was very good.
I put fresh mozzarella on the bread and put it in the broiler, then added the tomato topping.
delicious!!! lots of compliments.
I did add some diced red onion, and then drizzled a small amount of balsamic glaze, as a finishing touch!!
delicious
Delicious! An excellent appetizer. Will serve it often

This was so easy to put together and absolutely wonderful! Will be making this again very soon, husband even enjoyed and he isn't crazy about tomatoes. I made just a couple of adjustments, I used a mix of tomatoes instead of just Roma and I added just a small sprinkle, maybe about 1/2 teaspoon, of sugar to cut the bite of the balsamic vinegar.

Awesome! I made exactly as directed, letting the mixture chill for 2 hours. I served it cold on toasted homemade baguette. Had enough for leftovers and it was even better the second day. Next time I will make a day ahead.

I went a little off the reservation and added a third clove of garlic, some red onion and only had half the amount of tomatoes. The garlic was a tiiiiiny bit much but I do think the red onion adds a lot, especially if it's cut down to tiny little pieces.

The recipe was good but the portions for the vinegar salt were super short. It mostly tasted like tomato so I ended up just seasoning for taste. Added onions to it as well andit came out super good. Also leave the parmesan cheese out so it doesn't get super soggy
This was easy and tasted great! We had lots of extra tomatoes and this was a great way to use them. I didn't have fresh basil, but using 1/2 as much dry was fine.

Delicious! I used purple heirloom tomatoes from my garden and removed the seeds. I used grated parm as that's what I had on hand. Hubby toasted French bread in butter and topped with parm before topping with the bruchetta mixture. I didn't measure anything; I just tasted as I went.

Delicious recipe. I opted for different colored grape/cherry tomatoes and deseeded them and added a dash of red pepper chili flakes. I mix evoo with butter and pressed garlic and brushed the bread before baking. After assembled, I drizzled the bruschetta with a balsamic sauce. The best I’ve ever had.

I have made this recipe at least a dozen times, since our tomatoes came in. It's always a huge hit. I seed the tomatoes and use white balsamic so that the color of the tomatoes stay bright. Fantastic!
Great start! Alter to your liking, I added more garlic and balsamic. If possible make it early and allow to sit for a couple hours so the flavors can really fuse together.
It came out way too dry for my liking! Definitely add more vinegar and olive oil than what the recipe indicates.
Excellent as written. Just drain your tomatoes so they aren’t too wet. I sliced a baguette very thinly, brushed with olive oil and broiled until golden. Perfect.
For two of us I used two plum tomatoes, 2 garlic cloves, 1 tbsp balsamic, 1 tsp olive oil and feta instead of Parmesan and then basil when serving.
1st time ever making Bruschetta and my husband loves it! We love garlic so I used 8 garlic cloves. This also tasted well for breakfast on toasted English Muffins with eggs.

Made with fresh garden tomatoes, and 20 year old balsamic vinegar from Italy. Toasted the bread after brushing on some olive oil and sprinkles of dried basil and parsley. Needless to say, this was a very tasty appetizer that my husband and I enjoyed with a glass of red wine. Nice way to spend a Summer Sunday afternoon.
Amazing taste even easier to make! Subbed in mozzarella melted first but it was great!

I made it as written and it was good but a bit sour for my taste. I did brush olive oil and a garlic clove on the bread before grilling. My husband and I tried one as written , then for the rest I sprinkled some shredded mozzarella on top and drizzled with a balsamic glaze ( purchased at Kroger) and popped it in the oven to heat up . This put it over the top! It really balanced the flavors and made it 5 star. He wanted to know if we could have this all the time and he is extremely picky.
Easy , fast and tasty great with fresh ripe tomatoes

Great, easy recipe!!! I added a little extra cheese along with some extra fresh basil.
YUMMY!!!
I’ve made this many times and it’s always a hit. The family loves it! I usually put about double the balsamic because I love it
I toasted the bread and rubbed it with a raw garlic clove but no other tweaks to the recipe. Simple, solid recipe.

I like to toast the bread with a little garlic olive oil, then add a thin layer of goat cheese before adding the bruschetta topping, it makes a perfect party appetizer that doesn’t get soggy. We’ve been known to eat these the next day and they’re still delicious.
Great dish. I too, made some alterations over time: Red wine vinegar. Feta. Red onion. Parsley. Excellent. New and fresh idea for your guests

I toasted the baguette bread slices in a buttered skillet. I think just toaster would've been easier. since the butter was unnoticeable. I used buffalo motzerella instead of parmesan. Just let it sit on top of the other mixed ingredients. I think it looks better without the balsamic all over the white cheese for presentation. Really tasty and easy way to do caprese appetizer. Glad I found this one.
In addition to garlic in it I rub a clove on the toast as well
Loved this recipe.
I love this recipe. I’ve made it a few times, but I baked the bread the first time, and broiled it the second. The second time it was softer and easier to eat.
Simple, quick, flavorful, amazing, crowd pleaser
It was really good! We cut this recipe in half for my family of four and it made just enough for each of use to have two
Love it! I omitted the cheese and doubled the garlic.

I loved this easy bruschetta! I had the sourdough bread that you bake and I toasted it and put the tomato topping on top! Fast and easy! I didn't have fresh basil, so I used dried and it still tasted great!
Really good! I like to grill the bread instead of broiling, but it was yummy!
Easy, delicious and a pleasure to serve!!

This was a really good recipe! I forgot to include the balsamic vinegar and added extra garlic, and the result was delicious! I couldn't get enough of it! The longer it sits in the refrigerator, the better. All of the flavors mesh together beautifully. The next time I make this, I will try it with the balsamic vinegar. This is definitely a recipe worth keeping.
Love this recipe, made it twice in two weeks!!
Is very easy to make and tastes great! Have made before using Roma tomatoes but didn’t have any on hand. Removed seeds from non-Roma tomato and turned out just as good.
Oh my god. I can't even describe what feeling this Bruschetta hits. It was so light and airy and made me want more! You really know what you're doing, keep up the good work!
absolutely wonderful! Cut in half. Loved it. Thanks!
Simple to make, actually taste better the second day.
Forgot the Roma tomatoes. Used a can of Fire Roasted diced tomatoes. Also used vegan parmesan cheese ...came out very good.
This was so good and pretty easy to make. Don’t think I would change a thing!

Amazing! I made it almost exactly as the recipe dictates, except without Parmesan. I toasted French bread drizzled with olive oil on the oven, and served. It was delicious and one that I will make again! I did not seed the tomatoes, but would if I were not going to serve immediately.

holy heck this recipe was absolutely amazing and literally the easiest thing ever to make, you can follow the recipe to a T but i personally took some liberties to my own personal taste (added more cheese, balsamic olive oil, basil scooped out seeds from tomatoes) and as for the bread i didn’t have french bread on hand during the quarantine so in a pinch i took regular white bread, drizzled with olive oil, garlic powder, italian seasoning and broiled on high for a few minutes then flipped to the other side and broiled again for a few minutes. worked like a charm!!!!!! (what others suggested to do with french bread below) highly recommend this recipe cause it was absolutely delicious and super simple!!!!!
Made just as directed and it was delicious!
Two thumbs up from the family!
It’s great, I make tweaks depending on the type of bread I have but it’s always good.

I toasted the bread with garlic & butter first, then I put a couple of spinach leaves on top then my marinated diced tomatoes (balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, oregano, parsley & cavenders seasoning) then topped it off with feta cheese and drizzled balsamic glaze on top to make it fancy. YUM!
I used some different tomatoes, but it turned out delicious! I will make this again for sure. Perfect for an appetizer or snack.
So delicious to serve on any type of bread/stale/toasted/cracker/rounds; light but so fragrantly delicious!
